001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Set;
008import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
009import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
010import java.util.function.Supplier;
011
012import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.ElapsedTime;
013
014import com.technototes.library.subsystem.DeviceSubsystem;
015import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
016
017/**
018 * The root Command class
019 *
020 * @author Alex Stedman
021 */
022@FunctionalInterface
023public interface Command extends Runnable, Supplier<Command.CommandState> {
024
025    // These are *static* fields of the Command interface, because interfaces aren't allowed
026    // to have member fields (because they're interfaces...)
027
028    /**
029     * The Command to Current State of the Command lookup
030     */
031    Map<Command, CommandState> stateMap = new HashMap<>();
032    /**
033     * The Command to Total Time Spent Running lookup
034     */
035    Map<Command, ElapsedTime> timeMap = new HashMap<>();
036    /**
037     * The Command to Required Subsystems lookup
038     */
039    Map<Command, Set<Subsystem>> requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
040
041    /**
042     * Add requirement subsystems to command
043     * <p>
044     * Requirements are subsystems upon which this command depends. When executing a command,
045     * any commands that are currently being executed which depend upon the subsystem(s) required
046     * will be cancelled by the CommandScheduler.
047     *
048     * @param requirements The subsystems this command uses
049     * @return this
050     */
051    default Command addRequirements(Subsystem... requirements) {
052        getRequirements().addAll(Arrays.asList(requirements));
053        return this;
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Init the command
058     * <p>
059     * Defaults to doing nothing
060     */
061    default void initialize() {}
062
063    /**
064     * Execute the command
065     * <p>
066     * This is (probably) where the majority of your command belongs
067     */
068    void execute();
069
070    /**
071     * Return if the command is finished
072     * <p>
073     * Defaults to returning *true* which means that the command will execute once and complete.
074     *
075     * @return Is the command finished
076     */
077    default boolean isFinished() {
078        return true;
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * End the command
083     * <p>
084     * Defaults to doing nothing
085     *
086     * @param cancel True if the command was cancelled, False if it ended naturally
087     */
088    default void end(boolean cancel) {}
089
090    /**
091     * Run a command or series of ParallelCommands after this one
092     *
093     * @param c the list of commands to run
094     * @return the new SequentialCommandGroup of this Command, then the next set
095     */
096    default SequentialCommandGroup andThen(Command... c) {
097        return new SequentialCommandGroup(this, c.length == 1 ? c[0] : new ParallelCommandGroup(c));
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Delay the command for some time
102     *
103     * @param sec The number of sections to delay
104     * @return The new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
105     */
106    default SequentialCommandGroup sleep(double sec) {
107        return andThen(new WaitCommand(sec));
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Delay the command for some time
112     *
113     * @param sup A function that returns the number of sections to delay
114     * @return The new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
115     */
116    default SequentialCommandGroup sleep(DoubleSupplier sup) {
117        return andThen(new WaitCommand(sup));
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * After this command, wait until the condition function is true
122     *
123     * @param condition The function that returns true when ready to proceed
124     * @return the new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a Conditional Command
125     * for waiting
126     */
127    default SequentialCommandGroup waitUntil(BooleanSupplier condition) {
128        return andThen(new ConditionalCommand(condition));
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Run this command in parallel with additional commands
133     *
134     * @param c the command (or list of commands) to be run in parallel
135     * @return a ParallelCommandGroup of this command, and all the c commands
136     */
137    default ParallelCommandGroup alongWith(Command... c) {
138        Command[] c1 = new Command[c.length + 1];
139        c1[0] = this;
140        System.arraycopy(c, 0, c1, 1, c.length);
141        return new ParallelCommandGroup(c1);
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Runs all the commands specified in parallel *until this command is completed*
146     *
147     * @param c The command or list of commands to run in parallel with this command
148     * @return a new ParallelDeadlineGroup with this command, and all the other commands
149     */
150    default ParallelDeadlineGroup deadline(Command... c) {
151        return new ParallelDeadlineGroup(this, c);
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * Runs all the commands in parallel (including this command) until one of them finishes
156     *
157     * @param c the additional commands to run in parallel
158     * @return a ParallelRaceGroup
159     */
160    default ParallelRaceGroup raceWith(Command... c) {
161        Command[] c1 = new Command[c.length + 1];
162        c1[0] = this;
163        System.arraycopy(c, 0, c1, 1, c.length);
164        return new ParallelRaceGroup(c1);
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Creates a conditional command out of this
169     *
170     * @param condition The condition to run the command under
171     * @return the conditional command
172     */
173    default ConditionalCommand asConditional(BooleanSupplier condition) {
174        return new ConditionalCommand(condition, this);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Runs this command until it either finishes, or the timeout has elapsed
179     *
180     * @param seconds The maximum number of seconds to wait
181     * @return A ParallelRaceGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
182     */
183    default ParallelRaceGroup withTimeout(double seconds) {
184        return raceWith(new WaitCommand(seconds));
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Runs this command until it finishes, or until the condition supplied is true
189     *
190     * @param condition A boolean function that returns true if the command should be cancelled
191     * @return A ParallelRaceGroup of this command and a ConditionalCommand of condition
192     */
193    default ParallelRaceGroup cancelUpon(BooleanSupplier condition) {
194        return raceWith(new ConditionalCommand(condition));
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Runs this command only if the choiceCondition is met (i.e. returns true)
199     *
200     * @param choiceCondition a boolean function that determins if this command should run or not
201     * @return a ChoiceCommand with this command as the "true" command.
202     */
203    default ChoiceCommand onlyIf(BooleanSupplier choiceCondition) {
204        return new ChoiceCommand(choiceCondition, this);
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Run the commmand
209     */
210    @Override
211    default void run() {
212        switch (getState()) {
213            case RESET:
214                getRuntime().reset();
215                setState(CommandState.STARTED);
216                return;
217            case STARTED:
218                setState(CommandState.INITIALIZING);
219                return;
220            case INITIALIZING:
221                initialize();
222                setState(CommandState.EXECUTING);
223                // no return for fallthrough
224            case EXECUTING:
225                execute();
226                if (isFinished()) setState(CommandState.FINISHED);
227                return;
228            case INTERRUPTED:
229                // state to allow
230                setState(CommandState.CANCELLED);
231                return;
232            case CANCELLED:
233            case FINISHED:
234                end(isCancelled());
235                setState(CommandState.RESET);
236        }
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * The command state enum
241     */
242    enum CommandState {
243        /**
244         * The command has just be scheduled
245         */
246        RESET,
247        /**
248         * The command has been triggered
249         */
250        STARTED,
251        /**
252         * The command is initializing after having been triggered
253         */
254        INITIALIZING,
255        /**
256         * The command is running normally
257         */
258        EXECUTING,
259        /**
260         * The command has completed successfully
261         */
262        FINISHED,
263        /**
264         * The command is pending cancellation (but has not yet processed the cancellation)
265         */
266        INTERRUPTED,
267        /**
268         * The command has been cancelled
269         */
270        CANCELLED
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Return the amount of time since the command was first initialized
275     *
276     * @return The runtime as an {@link ElapsedTime}
277     */
278    default ElapsedTime getRuntime() {
279        ElapsedTime t = timeMap.putIfAbsent(this, new ElapsedTime());
280        return t != null ? t : timeMap.get(this);
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Return the command state: Probably don't use this
285     *
286     * @return The state as an {@link CommandState}
287     */
288    default CommandState getState() {
289        return stateMap.getOrDefault(this, CommandState.RESET);
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Set the command state: DEFINITELY DO NOT USE THIS!
294     *
295     * @param s The state to set this command to
296     * @return This command
297     */
298    default Command setState(CommandState s) {
299        stateMap.put(this, s);
300        return this;
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Return the subsystem requirements for this command
305     *
306     * @return The {@link DeviceSubsystem} requirements
307     */
308    default Set<Subsystem> getRequirements() {
309        requirementMap.putIfAbsent(this, new LinkedHashSet<>());
310        return requirementMap.get(this);
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Is this command finished?
315     *
316     * @return True if the command has finished, or has been cancelled
317     */
318    default boolean justFinished() {
319        return getState() == CommandState.FINISHED || getState() == CommandState.CANCELLED;
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * Is this command completed?
324     *
325     * @return True if the command has finished and NOT been cancelled.
326     */
327    default boolean justFinishedNoCancel() {
328        return getState() == CommandState.FINISHED;
329    }
330
331    /**
332     * Has the command just be started?
333     *
334     * @return True if the command was started, but hasn't yet been run
335     */
336    default boolean justStarted() {
337        return getState() == CommandState.STARTED;
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Is the command in some state of running/started/finished/cancelled
342     *
343     * @return True if the command is not in the RESET state
344     */
345    default boolean isRunning() {
346        return getState() != CommandState.RESET;
347    }
348
349    /**
350     * Exactly what it says
351     *
352     * @return True if the command has been cancelled
353     */
354    default boolean isCancelled() {
355        return getState() == CommandState.CANCELLED;
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * If the command is running, interrupt it such that it can be cancelled
360     */
361    default void cancel() {
362        if (isRunning() && !justFinished()) setState(CommandState.INTERRUPTED);
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Clear out the state, time, and requirement maps. Be careful with this one!
367     */
368    static void clear() {
369        stateMap.clear();
370        timeMap.clear();
371        requirementMap.clear();
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * This is a helper to create a new command from an existing command, but with additional
376     * subsystem requirements
377     *
378     * @param c The command to add the extra subsystem
379     * @param s The subsystem (or list of subsystems) to add to the commands requiremets
380     * @return The new command
381     */
382    static Command create(Command c, Subsystem... s) {
383        return c.addRequirements(s);
384    }
385
386    /**
387     * Gets the current state of the command (Supplier&lt;CommandState&gt;)
388     *
389     * @return The current CommandState of this command
390     */
391    @Override
392    default CommandState get() {
393        return getState();
394    }
395}
